New Records: Golden State Warriors set a new record with 21 three-pointers in a single game
Buddy Hield scored a career-high 28 points
Lindy Waters III set a career-high with eight rebounds
Key Match Events: The Warriors trailed by as many as 20 points but mounted a 20-point comeback
Lindy Waters III scored a game-turning three-pointer to give the Warriors their first lead since the opening minutes
Buddy Hield exploded for 25 points in the second half
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors were expected to struggle without Stephen Curry, Andrew Wiggins, and De'Anthony Melton but showed depth and perimeter shooting
Head Coach Steve Kerr emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense before the game
Post-Match Reflections: Buddy Hield expressed pride in the team's effort after the comeback win
Lindy Waters III highlighted the team's depth and shooting as key factors in the victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors will face the same New Orleans Pelicans on the second night of a back-to-back
Buddy Hield ranks second in the league in made three-pointers this season
